tei:handNotes.tei:handNote: Heinrich Schenker's hand, in black ink

tei:div.tei:ab: √ Fr. Lamond: Beethovenabend:This solo recital took place, according to the Neue freie Presse, at 7.30 on December 1 in the Bösendorfer Recital Hall. Lamond's program comprised Beethoven piano sonatas in B major, Op. 106 ("Hammerklavier"), C minor, Op. 13 ("Pathétique"), E major, Op. 31, No. 3, A major, Op. 26, and C major, Op. 53 ("Waldstein"). op. 106. Ohne jeglicher Fähigkeit das seelische Gleichnis der vom Autor nur ersatzweise gebrauchten „Notenzeichen“ zu bieten! Ganz außerhalb der Sphäre des vom Komponisten lebendig Erschauten, blos ein Sklave des Setzers u. der Handhaltung. Doch auch selbst die „Technik“ unzureichend! Unbegreiflich, wie nun gerade dieser Spieler als „der Beeth.interpret“ zu Namen u. Ansehen kommen konnte! Verwachsene Gestalt, verwachsene Seele, ‒ verwachsener, ge„Knödel“ter Anschlag. Fuge gelang am besten, doch auch nur vom „Abfertigungs“abstandpunkt.

√ Frederic Lamond: Beethoven evening: Op. 106. Lacking any ability to conjure up the mental image for which the composer's "notational signs" are merely a substitute! Not remotely within the sphere of what the composer vividly beheld, a mere slave to the music engraver and hand position. Even his very technique is inadequate! Unimaginable how this pianist could have come to be regarded and named as "the Beethoven interpreter"! Stunted shape, stunted mind, stunted, strangulated touch. The fugue was the most successful, but only in terms of its "execution."
Bei Mama.

!√ Philharm. Konzert (Mottl):This subscription concert by the Philharmonic Orchestra under Felix Mottl took place, according to the Neue freie Presse, at 1 p.m. on December 2 in the large hall of the Musikverein Building. The program included Schubert, Symphony No. 6 in C major, Karl Goldmark, Orchestral Scherzo in A major, Op. 45, and Hermann Goetz, Symphony in F major, Op. 9. (The concert was reviewed the next day by Julius Korngold, who favored this last work and called for a revival of Goetz's music.) Schuberts Symph. VI Cdur: Meist verfehlte Technik des Holzbläsersatzes (Hbl. ohne Fagott, Horn, oder Str.(!), im Gegensatz z.B. zum Klang einer Flöte auf Fagott u.s.w.!) Marschartig, also „Schubertisch,“ in allen Sätzen!). Der letzte Satz wohl der gelungenste u. satteste. (Von Haydn – Mozart oder Beeth, aber ringsum keine Spur; alle Technik auch viel zu unreif, um überhaupt in die Nähe jener Meister zu kommen).

Bei Baron Alphons. Dank für Förderung. Ausweichende Antwort betreffs des II. Bandes.Alphons Rothschild having funded the printing and promotion costs for Schenker's Harmonielehre (hence the thanks), which is volume I of the Neue musikalische Theorien und Phantasien, Schenker is here unsuccessfully seeking a financial guarantee for the forthcoming volume II, Kontrapunkt.
At Mama's place.

!√ Philharmonic Concert (Mottl): Schubert's Symphony No. 6 in C major: Mostly poor technique in the woodwind writing (woodwinds without bassoon, horn, or strings(!), in contrast, e.g., to the sonority of a flute with bassoon, etc.!) March-like, thus "Schubertian," in all movements! The last movement decidedly the most successful and satisfying. (But not a trace anywhere of Haydn, Mozart, or Beethoven; all aspects of technique far too immature to come anything like close to those masters.)
At Baron Alphons's place. My thanks for his support. Noncommittal reply concerning volume II.
„Ich habe viel zu sagen“ sagt mir einer der leersten Menschen (rp).
"I have much to say," said one of the most vacuous men (Ludwig Karpath) to me.
I. M. hart in der Antwort auf Güte u. Mitleid.This relates to the incident recorded in Schenker's diary on November 24. Frauenburleske, auch ‒ Roheit.

K.-V.This concert by the Vienna Concert Union with soloist Annie de Jong took place, according to the Neue freie Presse, at 7.30 p.m. on December 4 in the large hall of the Musikverein Building. The program comprised Haydn, Symphony in B major, Hob. I:102, Mozart, Violin Concerto in A major, K. 219, and Berlioz, Symphonie fantastique. bringt Mozart’s Violinkonzert A-dur (Frl. Annie de Jong, schöne Erscheinung, auch entsprechender Vortrag) u. Berlioz’ Symph. Phant. Letztere mit Frau Deutsch vorher gründlichst durchgearbeitet. (Haydn Symph. Bdur zu rasch u. ausdruckslos vorgetragen)
Irene Mayerhofer severe in her reply to kindness and compassion. Feminine burlesque, even rudeness.

The Concert Union presents Mozart's Violin Concerto in A major (Miss Annie de Jong, beautiful appearance, with performance to match), and Berlioz's Symphonie fantastique. The latter work gone through most thoroughly in advance with Mrs. Deutsch. (Haydn Symphony in B major performed too fast and expressionlessly.

Conzert Amalia Löwe:The song recital took place, according to the Neue freie Presse, at 7.30 p.m. on December 5 in the Bösendorfer Recital Hall. Unfertig oder unfähig? Doch erlesenes Programm. Frau T. Colbert bittet um Unterricht.

Ausspruch von Osc. Wilde: „Wenn ich eine Tulpe mit 4 Blättern sehe, so reizt es mich, eine mit 5 Bl. zu züchten, ein niedriger Mensch aber ist, der dann eine mit blos 3 Bl. ziehen will.“The English given here is Wilde's original saying: source unknown. Als Antwort auf den Vorwurf des Plagiats; Gegensatz zu kleinlichen Plagiatoren.
Concert by Amalia Löwe: immature or incapable? But excellent program. Mrs. Toni Colbert asks for lessons.

Saying by Oscar Wilde: "When I see a monstrous tulip with four wonderful petals in someone else's garden, I am impelled to grow a monstrous tulip with five wonderful petals, but that is no reason why someone should grow a tulip with only three petals." As an answer to the accusation of plagiarism; opposite to the petty plagiarists.

in left margin: (K. d. Vortrags)This marginal note (like that for December 12) suggests that Schenker was flagging this entry for possible use in the work that he was planning, Die Kunst des Vortrags, but of which he did not produce a first written draft until 1911. The handwriting is clearly contemporaneous with the entry itself. final version only: Sauer II:This, the second and final piano recital (the first having been on November 23), took place, according to the Neue freie Presse, at 7.30 p.m. on December 6 in the Bösendorfer Recital Hall. The program comprised Beethoven, Sonata in E major, Op. 109; Schumann, Toccata, Op. 7, Nachtstück [unspecified]; Mendelssohn, Scherzo from A Midsummer Night's Dream; Chopin, Fantasie, Op. 49, Nocturne in G major, Op. 37, No. 2, Waltz[?] [unspecified]; Sauer, Scherzo in B minor; Tarantelle fantastique; Les délices de Vienne (Valse de concert); Liszt, Ricordanza, Gnomenreigen, Harmonies du soir, and Mazeppa. Beeth. op. 109 (mit Brünauer studiert). roh, ohne Verständnis, besonders 2. Stz. Aber auch die Fingerfertigkeit erweist sich nicht verläßlich, (letzte Var.). Wozu dann der Lärm um diese, wenn sie bei den schwierigsten, in ihrer spezifischen Art sozusagen denkbarersten u. schönsten Aufgaben versagt, oder soll man eine Finger„technik“ auch dann noch groß nennen, wenn sie bei Stücken billigeren Geistes doch nur billig funktioniert? Abscheulicher Vortrag der Nocturne G-dur von Chopin (6/8); Ein Spieler von so flachem Geiste Leiter einer „Meister“schule! zumal Erster u. vorläufig einziger „K. K. Professor“ in Österreich! Welche confuse Welt!

in left margin: (Art of Performance) final version only: Sauer II: Beethoven, Op. 109 (studied with Brünauer). Raw, without understanding, especially in the second movement. But even the finger dexterity does not prove reliable (last variation). So what is all the fuss about the latter, when it lets him down in the most difficult, in its particular style so-to-speak most conceivable and most beautiful tasks. Or is one to call a finger technique still great, even when it functions, and then only shoddily, in pieces of lesser spirit? Wretched performance of the Chopin Nocturne in G major (6/8). A player of such shallow intellect, head of a "master" school!, especially since he is the first and for the time being the only Imperial-Royal Professor in Austria! What a mixed-up world!
Floriz bringt das Doppelkonz. für 2 Klv. von Ph. Em. Bach! (f dur) Mscp!
Floriz brings me the Double Concerto for two keyboards by C. P. E. Bach! (F major) manuscript!
Arbeit am Bach-Konz. Bei Frau Eissler zu Tisch.
Work on the Bach concerto. At Mrs. Eissler's for lunch.

Bach-Kz. (Fortsetzung). Missa solemnis (Schalk).The performance took place, according to the Neue freie Presse, at 12.30 p.m. on December 9 in the large hall of the Musikverein Building. On the previous day at 5 p.m. there had been a public final rehearsal. Fast durchweg ungenießbar falsche Darstellung (wegen zu hastiger Tempi!) Abends bei Frau I. M. (heiter.).

Work continued on the Bach concerto. Missa solemnis (Schalk). Almost without exception unpalatably wrong-headed performance (on account of excessively fast tempi!) In the evening, at Mrs. Irene Mayerhofer's (merry).
Bei Brünauers’ (67. Geburtstag des H. Brn.) Abends.
At the Brünauers' place (67th birthday of Mr. Brünauer) in the evening.
Löwe’s Besuch zu Tisch (Imperial). Freundliche Debatte im Caféhaus. Erste Scheelandschaft.
Löwe: visit for lunch (Imperial). Friendly argument in the coffee-house. First snowy landscape.
Beginn des großen Kulturkampfes in Frankreich!

in left margin: (K. d. Vtg.)This marginal note (like that for December 6) suggests that Schenker was flagging this entry for possible use in the work that he was planning, Die Kunst des Vortrags, but of which he did not produce a first written draft until 1911. The handwriting is clearly contemporaneous with the entry itself. √ K.-V.This concert by the Vienna Concert Society under Ferdinand Löwe took place, according to the Neue freie Presse, at 8 p.m. on December 12 in the large hall of the Musikverein Building. The program comprised the first Vienna performance of E. N. von Reznicek's Symphony in B major ("Sinfonietta"), Beethoven, Piano Concerto in E major ("Emperor") with pianist Alfred Reisenauer of Leipzig, Hugo Wolf, Italian Serenade, and Haydn, Symphony No. 104 in D major. Reisenauer spielt das Klv-Konz. Es dur von Beeth.: Mehrfach strenge, spröde, doch nicht ohne hier u. dort in die Nähe zu kommen. Mittelsatz mislingt, aber, hauptsächlich wegen Vernachlässigung der füllenden (oder brechenden) Stimmen (l. H.), die zur Kaltstellung auch der Melodie führt. ‒ Haydn’s Ddur Symph. nun wieder zu rasch vorgetragen; dagegen Löwes’ bona fides: „man musiziert nirgends so Haydn, wie im KV.“ da muß freilich jede Antwort, jede Berechtigung verstummen!
Beginning of the great cultural war in France!

in left margin: (Art of Performance) √ Concert Union: Reisenauer plays Beethoven's Piano Concerto in E major: much of the time strict, inflexible, but not without now and again coming close to what it should be. But the middle movement proves unsuccessful, primarily through neglect of the inner (or arpeggiating voices (left hand), which leads to impoverishment of the melody itself. ‒ Haydn's D major Symphony yet again performed too fast; contrary to that, Löwe's authoritative pronouncement: "Nowhere is Haydn's music played as it is in the Concert Society" ‒ any response to that, any correction, must of course remain unspoken!

Im „Apollo“-Theater mit Frau u. Dr. Rob. Brünauer – die Negertänze fast aufregend. Japaner leisten Wunderbares an Fantasie u. Energie. Auch sonst hübsche Fantasie in der Mannigfaltigkeit des Gebotenen.The advertisement for the Apollo Theater in the Neue freie Presse, December 13, 1906, p. 21, states: "Heute und täglich 8 Uhr abends das glänzende Dezember Festprogramm. Severin in der phantastischen Pantomime Pierrot als Don Juan mit dem Ensemble der Folies Bergère, Paris und Frl Stocker u G." ("Today and daily at 8 p.m. The spectacular December events program: Severin in the fantastic Pantomime Pierrot as Don Juan, with the ensemble of the Folies Bergère, Paris, and Miss Stocker and company."). It also advertises "Die lustige Witwe in ihrer zweiten Ehe" ("The Merry Widows in their Second Marriage").

In the Apollo Theatre with Dr. and Mrs. Robert Brünauer. The Negro dances very nearly exciting. The Japanese do wonderful things in the realms of imagination and energy. Delightful fantasies in the variety of other offerings.

tei:ab.tei:note: December 14 and 15 appear as a single entry.

tei:div.tei:ab: Bach concerto.
Bach Konz..December 14 and 15 appear as a single entry.
Bach concerto.

Rich. Strauss dirigiert (ph. Conz.):This, the fourth subscription concert of the season, took place, according to the Neue freie Presse, at 12.30 p.m. in the large hall of the Musikverein Building. The program was as Schenker indicates. Oberon ouv., Mozart’s Gmoll Symph. u. Eroica. Mit deutlichster Bloßstellung seiner Schwächen, seiner Unfähigkeit zur Synthese, u. des Mangels einer wirklich tief nachempfindenden – u. nachschaffenden Organisation! Verstöße gegen das Beste der Stücke allerarten. Wie ein Weib, ein Kind blos auf das Einzelne drauf los musiziert. Spannung aber im Publikum wegen des Autors der „Salome“!

Auf der Strasse heftig wider Secretär Botstiber, der sich in meiner Gegenwart eines gegenteiligen Urteils darüber vermaß! (Hammerschlag, Violin als Zeugen)
Spaß mit Karpath unter Zugrundelegung der Thatsache, daß Strauss das Andante von Moz. statt auf 6/8 gar auf 2 dirigierte.Schenker must mean the reverse of this, i.e. "in 6/8 rather than 2." Cf. his essay on the work in Meisterwerk II (1926), p. 144 (Eng. transl., p. 85): "Der Vortrag des Stückes [i.e. the Andante of Mozart's Symphony No. 40] erfordert ein in den halben Takten gehendes Tempo. [footnote: 'Einen berühmten Komponisten-Dirigenten sah ich einmal alle sechs Achtel ausschlagen.']" ("The performance of this movement requires a moving tempo with a dotted-quarternote pulse. [footnote: 'I once saw a famous composer-conductor beat out all six eighth notes.']"). The footnote, although written twenty years later, surely must refer back to this very 1906 performance. — Abends bei Frau Eissler, mit Barthlomey (Clarin.) Quintette von Moz. u. Brahms gespielt. Heiterer Abend.

Richard Strauss conducts (Philharmonic Concert): "Oberon" Overture, Mozart’s G minor Symphony, and the "Eroica." With the most naked exposure of his weaknesses, his inability to achieve synthesis, and his lack of any really deep empathy ‒ and interpretive organization! Offenses of all sorts against the best of the pieces. Like how a woman or child makes music merely upon a single idea. But excitement among the public concerning the composer of Salome!

On the street, I react violently toward Secretary Botstiber, who in my presence had the impudence to express a contrary opinion about it! (Hammerschlag and Violin as witnesses)
Joke with Karpath based on the fact that Strauss conducted the Andante of the Mozart in 2 rather than 6/8. — In the evening, at Mrs. Eissler's place, played quintets by Mozart and Brahms with Bartholomey (clarinet). A jolly evening.

Mittags zu, u. nach Tisch: Löwe u. Hirschfeld (Imperial). Technische Aufklärungen über R. Strauss vom gestrigen Concert geboten. Animiertes Beisammensein, wenn auch durch H.’s Journalistendünkel etwas gedämpft.
Prof. Rettich daselbst angetroffen. Beziehung freundlich fortzuspinnen gesucht.

Abends Concert Paul de Conne: This recital took place, according to the Neue freie Presse, at 7.30 p.m. on December 17. The program comprised Bach-Szántó, Prelude and Fugue in G minor for organ; Rubinstein, Grande Sonata in A minor, Op. 100; Liszt, Sposalizio, from Années de pélerinage (Italie); Chopin, Etude in A minor, Op. 10, No. 2, Etude in C major, Op. 10, No. 7, Nocturne in E major, Op. 9[, No. 2], Trois Ecossaises, Op. 72, Waltz in G major, Op. 70, No. 1, Allegro de concert in A major, Op. 46; Max Jentsch, Ballade in B minor, Op. 63; E. J. Wolff, Eine Liebesnovelle in D minor, Op. 6; F. Blumenfeld, Etude in A minor, Op. 24; Strauss-Schütt, Wiener Blut; and Strauss-Schulz-Evler, Arabesques on Themes from the Waltz "The Blue Danube". Gute Technik, zuweilen auch schönes Spiel. Nur leider noch gleichsam physiologisch unreif: knabenhafte Darstellung des Pathos von Rubinstein (Sonate amoll op. 100.), zu kindlich-dicht herunterdeklamiert, zu einfach, zu rasch, ohne Aufenthalt. Prof. Robert’s schmeichelhafte Anerkennung mit dem üblichen Zusatz: „Ich bin natürlich nicht mit Allem einverstanden.“ (?!) Spaziergang nach dem Konzert in schöner Schneelandschaft. Winternacht.
Entsetzliche Geldcalamitäten, da die Zahlung von Brn. u. Klob. (160 fl) ausgeblieben. Zu Tisch zu wenig Geld . .

Mid-day, at lunch and after: Löwe and Hirschfeld (Imperial). Technical clarifications offered arising from yesterday's concert regarding Richard Strauss. Lively get-together, albeit Hirschfeld's journalistic conceitedness put something of a damper on it.
Prof. Rettich encountered at the same place. Continuation of contact sought in friendly fashion.

In the evening, concert by Paul de Conne: Good technique, from time to time also beautiful playing, except that he is still, so to speak, physiologically immature: puerile depiction of Rubinstein's pathos (Sonata in A minor, Op. 100), too intensely childishly lacking in subtlety, too simple, too fast, without repose. Professor Robert's obsequious approval, with his customary afterthought: "Naturally, I am not in agreement with everything." (?!) Walk after the concert in beautiful snowy landscape. Winter night.
Frightful financial calamities, since the payments due from Brünauer and Klobassa (160 florins) have not arrived. Not enough money to put food on the table . . .

K.V. R. Strauss „A. sprach Zarathustra“, misfällt mir nach wie vor.The Vienna Concert Society's performance took place, according to the Neue freie Presse, at 7.30 p.m. on December 18 in the large hall of the Musikverein Building. The progam comprised: Mendelssohn, Symphony No. 4 in A major ("The Italian"), Beethoven, Piano Concerto No. 2 in B major, with pianist Karl Friedberg of Cologne, and the second Vienna performance of Richard Strauss's Also sprach Zarathustra. Misverhältnis zwischen Aufwand u. Stoff: Effekt nur eben des Aufwandes selbst. Nach d. Konz.: Beisammensein mit Löwes’, Artaria, Hammerschlag, Seelig etc; heftige Debatten.

in left margin: (K. u. Volk)"Kunst und Volk": a c.3,000-word draft essay with this title survives in the Oster Collection at File B, pp. 406‒17 (previously situated in File 31) ‒ part of a larger project entitled "Kunst und die Teilnehmenden" ("Art and its Participants"). A transcription with English translation of "Kunst und Volk" is included in Georg Burgstaller, Kritikerdämmerung: Heinrich Schenker and Music Journalism (PhD diss., University of Southampton, 2015), pp. 224‒32. Cf. Schenker's diary for November 10, 1906 with reference to an essay "Kunst und Publikum" ("Art and the Public"). Meine Polemik gegen die allzu sentimentale Popularisierung der Musik, da nicht einmal auch Verständnis bei denjenigen zu finden, die darauf ausgehen u. sich vermessen, sie zu „popularisieren”! Wette mit Dir. Hammerschlag eingegangen bezüglich der Zeilenzahl in Otto Jahn’s Mozart’s Biographie betreffend die Symph. G-moll: Ich meinte 40; in Wahrheit sind es 60, im letzten Grunde aber nicht eine!

Concert Union. Richard Strauss Also sprach Zarathustra displeases me now, as the previous time. Disproportion between luxuriance and substance: all that comes over is the luxuriance. After the concert, a get-together with Löwe, Artaria, Hammerschlag, Seelig etc; violent disagreement.

in left margin: ("Art and the People") My polemic against the overly sentimental popularisation of music, since one does not even find comprehension among those who set out to presume to "popularize" it! A bet entered into with Director Hammerschlag as to how many lines in Otto Jahn's Mozart biography are devoted to the Symphony in G minor. I guessed 40; in actuality there are 60, but when it comes down to it there isn't a single one.

Floriz wird unwohl. Hast! Abends unerfreuliches Musizieren bei Familie Thorsch. Conflikt mit Musikalienhandlung Rosé (Hainauer). Lebhafter, unhöflicher Briefwechsel. Zahlung der angeblichen Schuld für Jänner u. März zugesagt.

Floriz is sick. Hurry! In the evening, desultory music-making at the Thorsch family's place. Conflict with the sheet music retailer Rosé (Hainauer). Spirited, ill-mannered exchange of letters. Payment of the alleged debt for January and March promised.

Bei Frau Deutsch, letzter Kammermusikabend: ich spiele Haydn’s Klaviertrio Esdur Nr.4, Frau D. Schumanns Kl.quartett Es dur, Frau Colbert
Brahms’ Klquartet A-dur. Zu Tisch entpuppt sich ein Bruder der Hausfrau, H. Fritz Mendel, als ausgezeichneter, kluger Mensch, u. ebenso vortrefflicher Mann, u. Vater. Weihnachtsgeschenk von Frau Eissler: Brahms’ Briefwechsel,Johannes Brahms: Briefwechsel, published by the Deutsche Brahms Gesellschaft in sixteen volumes (Berlin, 1907‒22), of which vols I and II were edited by Max Kalbeck. ‒ Presumably the first volume was released in time for Christmas 1906. Wein. Beide Sachen sehr erfreulich. Ad. v. Goldschmidts Tod in vollster Einsamkeit!

At Mrs. Deutsch's apartment, the final chamber music evening: I play Haydn's Piano Trio No. 4 in E major, Mrs. Deutsch plays Schumann's Piano Quartet in E major, Mrs. Colbert
plays Brahms's Piano Quartet in A major. At lunch a brother of our hostess, Mr. Fritz Mendl, reveals himself as an excellent, clever person and an equally splendid husband and father. Christmas present from Mrs. Eissler: Brahms's correspondence, and wine. Both items most agreeable. Adalbert von Goldschmidt's death, totally alone!

Leichenbegängnis A. v. G. In der Karlskirche, am Friedhof gewesen ‒ welcher Ausgang eines nicht so üppigen, geselligen Lebens! Verlassen von Freunden, die ihn genoßen u. benützten (Geist, wie Geld u. Beziehungen), u. begleitet nur von Freunden der letzten ärmsten Jahre! Ich, der ihm einmal verhaßteste Mensch, der einzige am Friedhof, hinter seinem Sarge. Welche Ironie! Im Trauerwagen geht Karl Kraus gewesen — ähnliche Ironie!

Funeral of Adalbert von Goldschmidt. I was at the Karlskirche, and at the cemetery ‒ what an exit, for a man who lived unostentatiously and sociably! Abandoned by friends who had enjoyed his company and took advantage of him (his spirit, as well as his money and his connections), and accompanied only by friends from his final, impoverished years! I, at one time the person he most despised, the only one at the cemetery, behind his coffin. What an irony! In the funeral carriage travels Karl Kraus — likewise, an irony!
Brief mit angeblich verwetteten Cigarren an Hammerschag, ‒ eine scharfe Lection! Ein für allemal!
Letter to Hammerschag with cigars allegedly the result of a bet ‒ a painful lesson! Never again!
Bei Sectionsrath Theob. Pollak wegen Felix P. Transferierung nach Wien. Besuch bei Floriz. Abends Ordnungswuth u. Erledigung aller Rückstände.
With Departmental Counselor Theobald Pollak regarding Felix Pollak. Transfer to Vienna. Visit to Floriz. In the evening, the anguish of having to put things in order and deal with all backlog items.
√ Em. Bach Konz. hart in Arbeit genommen.
√ Work on the C. P. E. Bach concerto vigorously taken up.
√ Schalk u. Löwe im Caféhaus. Gärtner ladet zu C. Redlich ein, Ablehnung. Konzert fertiggestellt. Strenge mehrstündige Arbeit.
√ Schalk and Löwe in the coffee-house. Gärtner invites me to C. Redlich ‒ I decline. Concerto finalized. Many hours of strenuous work.

Bei Löwe, der Hörner refüsiert.Perhaps in the planned performance of the C. P. E. Bach double concerto? Cf. the entry for December 7 and subsequent references. Thus "New work [needed on the double concerto]." The work was rehearsed on January 29, 1907. Neue Arbeit. Abends bei Violins’ bis 10. Sodann zu Hause.
With Löwe who says "No" to horns. New work. In the evening, at the Violins' until 10, then back home.
